posts.subject: Questionable Malcontent - Homeless Edition
posts.body:
Hopefully more than one anon made it. 
Last thread: http://archive.fo/0Q3Vt (Gauss Blur)
Archives (which will actually get updated eventually):
Edits: https://gitgud.io/InfinityMalcontent/QMC_Edits/tree/master
OC: https://gitgud.io/InfinityMalcontent/QMC_OC/tree/master
Threads archive: https://gitgud.io/InfinityMalcontent/QMC_Threads/wikis/home
Older stuff (Editfag Prime):
Edits: http://imgur.com/a/Sf5J0
Omits: http://imgur.com/a/HtKr0
Twitter Bully: http://imgur.com/a/Jb1a1

>>5771e3d3-52ae-46ca-a6f6-2d30107b8962
The most insane thing is trying to pull at heartstrings because a guy who owns a gigantic company woke up one day and decided to throw his weight around for the second time. A company that's still embroiled in lawsuits about not taking down copyright infringing sites and then continuing to serve them when they pop back up.

>>774ac973-8bfb-49a7-9a17-774b583e52c1
He absolutely tried to, saying that Jim and Ron forced Cloudflare to break their vow and censor things they don't like. The fact that it's nonsensical and Price has a previous history of doing exactly what he did is why it's insane.
http://archive.is/FCg6X

>>ce8e8ecb-930f-46d2-9354-fd27a2868144
Cripple faces a massive onslaught of bad press, illegal content, a transexual congressional candidate named John Flynt, and a dedicated fanbase of retards pretending to be extra retarded to fuck with him for a few years. He eventually signs on with NT Tech, who ran 2ch. At some point Null from Kiwifarms was brought on to make new imageboard software with around 12,000 USD of donated shekels, the picture is an accurate display of how that went. After some time he steps down and lets Ron take over the day to day running of the site, then leaves completely. Something like a year passes, and he starts saying that he didn't want to step down and that Jim forced him out and he was scared. Then he decides he's a christian and does a few theological debates along with some round vs. flat earth ones, decides that Josh dindunuffin and it was everyone else's fault that the previously software didn't work, begins a soy diet, and now he's starring on CNN to happily tell his tale about 8ch, so named for the 8 miliion that will be thrown from cargo helicopters.

>>cb42250b-cca5-4546-acd5-1d4824d241ff
Now he has an NBC piece and his fucking buddy there is tweeting freeze peach and "How to bypass Safe Harbor 101". 
http://archive.fo/l5rOd
http://archive.is/GfVt5
http://archive.fo/dv1XT
http://archive.fo/wyOya

>>67631857-b10d-46d8-b735-4306d506963b
Yeah, different anon. It didn't seem right to not end the day off without handstab removing a bit of humor, even with everything in disarray.

>>00e7358d-c927-4030-b67f-f7db1d367f0f
If that's the case, it'd be great if he had the balls to just send in 47 U.S.C. § 230 in 30 point font.

>>5bb9587f-96a2-4d11-8a52-2087da0d3c4a
They did, but they were still going to supply DNS. Bitmitigate has started naming the people that dropped publicly, by the way. They've previously stated that they're pretty confident it was a breach of contract.
http://archive.is/knyr4
